headline.main: Less Risk Found in Low-Tar Cigarettes

docs.abstract: Dr E Cuyler Hammond repts research showing that smoking cigarettes lower in tar and nicotine can reduce smoking-caused deaths from cancer and heart disease; suggests brands designated high in tar and nicotine be removed from mkt; study confirms that pipe and cigar smokers have higher rates of many types of cancer than cigarette smokers; chart indicates tar and nicotine contents of cigarette brands (M)

keywords.value: TOBACCO, TOBACCO PRODUCTS AND SMOKERS ARTICLES
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Cancer researchers reported yesterday the first definitive evidence that smoking cigarettes lower in tar and nicotine can reduce smoking-caused deaths from cancer and heart disease.
docs.snippet: Cancer researchers reported yesterday the first definitive evidence that smoking cigarettes lower in tar and nicotine can reduce smoking-caused deaths from cancer and heart disease.
